instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-5029: What is 820-5029? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 2014 27" imac with dong but no sound only digital
threads.message:
hi have a  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-5029</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> all working, comes dong in the beginning. mic working, but no intern speaker.

only digital output and the red light is on on the back of the imac. headphones are working and are shown

i pluged already the conector off (J6500) but still the same

need some help here please

threads.title: 2014 27" imac with dong but no sound only digital
threads.message:
Probably bad audio connector.

Remove <RESISTOR>R6796</RESISTOR> and check if problem disappears.
Be aware, SPDIF out will be disabled.

threads.title: 2014 27" imac with dong but no sound only digital
threads.message: thanks, that was that what i was looking for. unfortunatly this was not the problem. but looking for <RESISTOR>R6796</RESISTOR> I found on the board L6509 ripped off. so of course that was it. I dont know why i didnt saw that yesterday. thanks for help. case closed.
